comments.body: I'm confused about the version upgrade. The changes below look good from a cleanliness perspective, but there's no change in the actual typings. Why not leave it at the lower version, since it doesn't look like anything's changed?

Good point, in fact nothing has been changed between that versions in the end-user perspective.

But while other types packages are in most cases representing the package version why should this one be different?

I mean while installing `koa-logger@^3.1.0` as an user I would like to also have types in version `@types/koa-logger@^3.1.0` to not confuse users who don't know about that similarities. Does it make sense?
